In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **L** serves the following purposes:

- l represents a [leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun_\(monster_class\) "Leprechaun (monster class)"), a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") consisting only of the titular [leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun").

- L represents a [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)"):

  - L [lich](/wiki/Lich "Lich")
  - L [demilich](/wiki/Demilich "Demilich")
  - L [master lich](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich")
  - L [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich")

* It is also used as a [direction](/wiki/Direction "Direction") key if [numpad](/wiki/Numpad "Numpad") movement is off:

  - Press [l]() to move east.
  - Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [L]() to move far east.

- If numpad movement is on:

  - Press [l]() to [loot](/wiki/Loot "Loot") a container.
  - Press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [l]() to redraw the screen.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a port of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [lizards](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") use the l glyph, while [rock lobsters](/index.php?title=Rock_lobster\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Rock lobster (page does not exist)") use the L glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the l glyph is given to the [leocrotta](/wiki/Leocrotta "Leocrotta"), while the L glyph is given to the [leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun "Leprechaun") - both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), and continue to use those glyphs up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the [quadruped](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is introduced and uses the q glyph; the leocrotta is made part of the quarduped monster class, while the [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)") monster class is introduced and given the l glyph in its place. In [NetHack 3.0.6](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.6 "NetHack 3.0.6"), the glyphs of the leprechaun and lich monster classes were exchanged, resulting in their current glyphs.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces a couple of new monsters that each use the l and L glyphs:

- l leprechaun:
  - l [leprechaun wizard](/wiki/Leprechaun_wizard "Leprechaun wizard")
- L lich:
  - L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces some new monsters that use the L glyph:

- L lich:

  - L [baelnorn](/wiki/Baelnorn "Baelnorn")
  - L [death knight](/wiki/Death_knight "Death knight")
  - L [dokkalfar eternal matriarch](/wiki/Dokkalfar_eternal_matriarch "Dokkalfar eternal matriarch")
  - L [Acererak](/wiki/Acererak "Acererak")
  - L [Lich, the Fiend of Earth](/wiki/Lich,_the_Fiend_of_Earth "Lich, the Fiend of Earth")
  - Deferred monsters
    - L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") adds two new monsters that use the L glyph:

- L lich:

  - L [worm that walks](/wiki/Worm_that_walks "Worm that walks")
  - L [eye of fear and flame](/index.php?title=Eye_of_fear_and_flame\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eye of fear and flame (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds one new monster that uses the L glyph:

- L lich:
  - L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters that use the l and L glyphs:

- l leprechaun:

  - l [boggart](/index.php?title=Boggart\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Boggart (page does not exist)")
  - l [pooka](/wiki/Pooka "Pooka")
  - l [leprechaun elder](/index.php?title=Leprechaun_elder\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Leprechaun elder (page does not exist)")
  - l [leprechaun king](/index.php?title=Leprechaun_king\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Leprechaun king (page does not exist)")

- L lich:
  - L [baby lich](/index.php?title=Baby_lich\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Baby lich (page does not exist)")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds several monsters that use the l and L glyphs from other variants:

- l leprechaun:
  - l [leprechaun wizard](/wiki/Leprechaun_wizard "Leprechaun wizard")

- L lich:

  - L [worm that walks](/wiki/Worm_that_walks "Worm that walks")
  - L [eye of fear and flame](/index.php?title=Eye_of_fear_and_flame\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eye of fear and flame (page does not exist)")
  - L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

L

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the notable community member, see L (person).
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter L serves the following purposes:

  • l represents a leprechaun, a monster class consisting only of the titular leprechaun.
  • L represents a lich:
    • L lich
    • L demilich
    • L master lich
    • L arch-lich
  • It is also used as a direction key if numpad movement is off:
    • Press l to move east.
    • Press shift + L to move far east.
  • If numpad movement is on:
    • Press l to loot a container.
    • Press ctrl + l to redraw the screen.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 SpliceHack
    • 2.4 EvilHack
    • 2.5 SlashTHEM
    • 2.6 Hack'EM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a port of Jay Fenlason's Hack, lizards use the l glyph, while rock lobsters use the L glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the l glyph is given to the leocrotta, while the L glyph is given to the leprechaun - both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in Hack 1.0, and continue to use those glyphs up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the quadruped monster class is introduced and uses the q glyph; the leocrotta is made part of the quarduped monster class, while the lich monster class is introduced and given the l glyph in its place. In NetHack 3.0.6, the glyphs of the leprechaun and lich monster classes were exchanged, resulting in their current glyphs.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces a couple of new monsters that each use the l and L glyphs:

  • l leprechaun:
    • l leprechaun wizard
  • L lich:
    • L Vecna

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces some new monsters that use the L glyph:

  • L lich:
    • L baelnorn
    • L death knight
    • L dokkalfar eternal matriarch
    • L Acererak
    • L Lich, the Fiend of Earth
    • Deferred monsters
      • L Vecna

SpliceHack

SpliceHack-Rewrite adds two new monsters that use the L glyph:

  • L lich:
    • L worm that walks
    • L eye of fear and flame

EvilHack

EvilHack adds one new monster that uses the L glyph:

  • L lich:
    • L Vecna

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters that use the l and L glyphs:

  • l leprechaun:
    • l boggart
    • l pooka
    • l leprechaun elder
    • l leprechaun king
  • L lich:
    • L baby lich

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds several monsters that use the l and L glyphs from other variants:

  • l leprechaun:
    • l leprechaun wizard
  • L lich:
    • L worm that walks
    • L eye of fear and flame
    • L Vecna

{{otheruses||the notable community member|L (person)}}
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''L''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|l}} represents a [[Leprechaun (monster class)|leprechaun]], a [[monster class]] consisting only of the titular [[leprechaun]].
* {{white|L}} represents a [[Lich (monster class)|lich]]:
** {{monsymlink|lich}}
** {{monsymlink|demilich}}
** {{monsymlink|master lich}}
** {{monsymlink|arch-lich}}

* It is also used as a [[direction]] key if [[numpad]] movement is off:
** Press {{kbd|l}} to move east.
** Press {{kbd|shift|L}} to move far east.

* If numpad movement is on:
** Press {{kbd|l}} to [[loot]] a container.
** Press {{kbd|ctrl|l}} to redraw the screen.

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21, a port of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], [[lizard]]s use the {{white|l}} glyph, while [[rock lobster]]s use the {{white|L}} glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the {{white|l}} glyph is given to the [[leocrotta]], while the {{white|L}} glyph is given to the [[leprechaun]] - both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in [[Hack 1.0]], and continue to use those glyphs up to [[NetHack 2.3e]].

In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], the [[quadruped]] [[monster class]] is introduced and uses the {{white|q}} glyph; the leocrotta is made part of the quarduped monster class, while the [[Lich (monster class)|lich]] monster class is introduced and given the {{white|l}} glyph in its place. In [[NetHack 3.0.6]], the glyphs of the leprechaun and lich monster classes were exchanged, resulting in their current glyphs.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces a couple of new monsters that each use the {{white|l}} and {{white|L}} glyphs:

* {{white|l}} leprechaun:
** {{monsymlink|leprechaun wizard}}
* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{monsymlink|Vecna}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] introduces some new monsters that use the {{white|L}} glyph:

* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{brightgreen|L}} [[baelnorn]]
** {{brightcyan|L}} [[death knight]]
** {{black|L}} [[dokkalfar eternal matriarch]]
** {{yellow|L}} [[Acererak]]
** {{brown|L}} [[Lich, the Fiend of Earth]]
** Deferred monsters
*** {{monsymlink|Vecna}}

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack-Rewrite]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|L}} glyph:

* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{green|L}} [[worm that walks]]
** {{orange|L}} [[eye of fear and flame]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds one new monster that uses the {{white|L}} glyph:

* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{monsymlink|Vecna}}

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds other new monsters that use the {{white|l}} and {{white|L}} glyphs:

* {{white|l}} leprechaun:
** {{brown|l}} [[boggart]]
** {{white|l}} [[pooka]]
** {{red|l}} [[leprechaun elder]]
** {{magenta|l}} [[leprechaun king]]
* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{yellow|L}} [[baby lich]]

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds several monsters that use the {{white|l}} and {{white|L}} glyphs from other variants:

* {{white|l}} leprechaun:
** {{monsymlink|leprechaun wizard}}
* {{white|L}} lich:
** {{green|L}} [[worm that walks]]
** {{orange|L}} [[eye of fear and flame]]
** {{monsymlink|Vecna}}
